content.description: An awkward weakness on the far left side of Maple Wall turned out to be an okay line. Follow the obvious weakness through some face climbing down low, to an off width section. P.S. don’t expect to get off this route looking very clean. The crack can be a little dirty.
content.protection: Cams from BD .5-3 should be more than sufficient to protect the route.    To Descend: Top out, and continue straight ahead to the obvious large tree to rappel off.
content.location: Continue walking past the furthest bolted line, “Mellow Mood” until you see an obvious crack that leads all the way up the wall.

content.description: Begin just right of the blank roof. Climb the big jugs up the ever so slightly overhanging arete and roofs. Continue up through the crux to the left facing flake. Finish on easier face climbing above.
content.location: 3rd bolted line from right to left.

content.description: Route begins 10' left of Loggia. Climb up the face to "bird poo ledge". (the white stuff is NOT chalk). Don't let this deter you from this most fun route... climb up into and out of the very fun and interesting corner to the moderate clean face climbing above.
content.location: 10' left of bolt line of Loggia. Finish on the shuts of Loggia or take it to the top and walkoff left or right.  Watch for Copperheads on top and walking off.

content.description: Climb the first three bolts of Loggia. Start heading right under the roof to the inside corner. Follow corner through several overlaps to the top.
content.location: Same start as Loggia, then heads right.

content.description: This line begins just 15' left of Solstice. Climb up the easy face and inside corner to the imposing roof. Move out delicate holds to a jug in the center of the roof. Commit and pull up over the lip to the ledge. From the ledge finish on easier climbing above.
content.location: Between Solstice and Get Up, Stand Up

content.description: Climb up the short face passing 2 bolts to the main larger overhang. Climb out the overhang and pull the crux at the lip to gain the rest in the blocky section above. Finish by moving up and right to the shuts under the alcove above. Fixed draws on the roof clips.
content.location: Climb the line out the center of the main overhang (above the stone seats). Start on the right end of the large block under the overhang.

content.description: Climb up easy 5.4 moves from the ledge to the base of the overhang.  Climb through the overhang, finish on face moves to the top.
content.location: Start up the route directly in front of the bench on Loggia's Ledge.

content.description: This is a highly recommended route... Climb up the short face passing the first two bolts to the base of the roof. Clip the bolt under the roof and make the commiting moves right out over the lip. Pull up to the rest ledge. Shake it out and continue up and left through the bulging crux and continue up to the comfort ledge. Finish on the short easy section to the shuts. NOTE: watch for copperheads if rigging this one on top rope. One seems to live under the rock perched on the edge of the cliff. It usually lays in the leaves on top and blends in very well. A colorful specimen of the local copperheads. Please admire, dont harm or disrupt. Thanks.
content.location: Second bolted line from Right to left

content.description: Climb up through generous holds to a tricky stance on the right tip of Loggia ledge. Make a commiting move off the ledge and up to easier climbing.  Continue left around the tree.  Finish on the flake and buckets above. Fun climbing!
content.location: Start is below the right end of Loggia's Ledge (ledge with log bench seat).

content.description: Start 10 feet right of Mellow Mood. Climb up the obvious inside corner. Hit the ledge and continue up the left-facing flake to to your right to the top of the cliff.
content.location: Starts on Loggia's Ledge to the right of Mellow Mood

content.description: This is the 3rd climbable crag. Visible from the bike trail, but not nearly as visible as the School House Wall. After the short hop through the woods from bike trail to crag, You'll find yourself standing below the bulging, overhanging, 90' tall Central Area wall. Plenty of moderates to the left and you'll find the harder stuff is to the right. Also of NOTE: there is a short, but very strenuous Right wall if you skirt under the overhangs and move right of the main cliff.
